doc.repnme: Firm-level surveys to aid private sector development strategies
doc.abstracts: Firm-level surveys are a systematic way of including the views and experiences of individual private firms in the design of policy programs to remove constraints to private sector growth. The surveys often are a part of the World Bank Group's Private Sector Assessment--a wide-ranging study of the role of the private sector in an economy, the constraints to private sector development, and the implications of both for the country and for the Bank Group's work. Some surveys have not been able to correctly identify costs, ensure systematic implementation, and manage the risk of survey errors. This Note outlines various approaches to address these problems. It also uses previous lessons learned to alert survey designers of survey risks.
